intro: Eleocharis halophila, commonly known as saltgrass, is a halophytic plant adapted to grow in saline environments. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant has small, spike-like inflorescences that produce tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its ability to tolerate high salt concentrations makes it an important species in coastal and estuarine ecosystems. Eleocharis halophila plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
